bibl.title: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to S. M. Sparkman, June 11, 1901

div1.p: Sternberg can only spare a few more copies of “The Etiology of Yellow Fever” and does not have the authority to print several thousand copies. He proposes that Sparkman introduce a bill to Congress in order to print additional copies.

div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to S. M. Sparkman, June 11, 1901
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL
JUN 27
1901
WAR DEPARTMENT
June 11, 1901.
Hon. S. M. Sparkman, M. C.,
Tampa, Florida.
Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
Replying to your letter of June 8th
I regret to say that I can only spare you
a few more copies of the Report on The Eti-
ology of Yellow Fever. I will send six
copies to your address. I have no authority
to print several thousand copies for distri-
bution as you suggest, but you might intro-
duce a bill in Congress next winter author-
izing the publication of such number of copies
as you think best.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, G. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
